result.execSummary:
The defendant James Carr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 4 Days.
02-09-2015:  Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.

superMiscConds.notes:
Complete High School Education within 6 months.

Maintain/Obtain full time employment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Within First 6 months of Extended Supervision obtain a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Buy Money, Cost #2 Paid In Full.  Surcharge  to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Modification of Sentence due to completion of Challenge Incarceration Program
from Atty. Szczewski regarding eligibiliby for prison programs
dated 2/4/15 filed by the defendant; wanting the Judgdment of conviction corrected regarding the substance abuse program

Defendant James Carr in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties discuss PSI.
Sentencing argument by Atty. Westphal and Atty. Szczewski.
Statement by defendant's mother.  

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 2
Imposed Sentence of:

 54 months Imprisonment (Credit - 4 days )
- 18 months  of Initial Confinement
-  36 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
-Complete high school education within 6 months.
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Within first 6 months of ES obtain a valid driver's license;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

Buy Money:  $200.00 BAIL TO APPLY

Costs: $268.00  BAIL TO APPLY
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00

Defendant is  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

COUNT 5
Imposed  and stayed Sentence of:

54 months  Imprisonment 
- 18 months of Initial Confinement
- 36 months  of Extended Supervision

Term of probation:  3 years CONSECUTIVE  to Count 2

Conditions of Probation: SAME AS COUNT 2

Costs: $268.00 BAIL APPLY
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00

Defendant is  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

(Costs/surcharges to be paid as a condition of extended supervision/probation)

Defendant James Carr in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea Colloquy.
